intro: Clinopodium vulgare var. parviflorum, commonly known as narrowflower betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a mint-like aroma. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
